events.originalText: George Floyd, an African-American man, was murdered during an arrest by a white police officer in Minneapolis, sparking protests in the U.S. and other countries.
events.subtitle: George Floyd
events.headline: George Floyd Murdered by White Police Officer in Minneapolis, Sparking Protests

events.originalText: Naxalite insurgents of the Communist Party of India (Maoist) attacked a convoy of Indian National Congress leaders in the state of Chhattisgarh, causing at least 27 deaths.
events.subtitle: Naxalite–Maoist insurgency
events.headline: Naxalite Insurgents Attack Indian National Congress Convoy, 27 Dead

events.originalText: In a test flight, SpaceX's Dragon became the first commercial spacecraft to rendezvous and berth with the International Space Station.
events.subtitle: SpaceX COTS Demo Flight 2
events.headline: SpaceX's Dragon First Commercial Spacecraft to Dock with ISS

events.originalText: The final episode of The Oprah Winfrey Show, the highest-rated daytime talk show in U.S. television history, was broadcast.
events.subtitle: The Oprah Winfrey Show
events.headline: Final Episode of The Oprah Winfrey Show Broadcast

events.originalText: North Korea conducted a nuclear test and several other missile tests that were widely condemned by the international community and led to sanctions from the United Nations Security Council.
events.subtitle: 2009 North Korean nuclear test
events.headline: North Korea Conducts Nuclear Test, Faces International Condemnation

events.originalText: Six-year-old Etan Patz disappeared on his way to school in New York City, and later became one of the first missing children to have his picture featured on milk cartons.
events.subtitle: Disappearance of Etan Patz
events.headline: Six-year-old Etan Patz Disappears in New York City

events.originalText: During takeoff from O'Hare International Airport in Chicago, an engine detached from American Airlines Flight 191, causing a crash that killed 273 people, the deadliest aviation accident in United States history.
events.subtitle: O'Hare International Airport
events.headline: American Airlines Flight 191 Crash Kills 273 in Chicago

events.originalText: Having purged a group of rivals, Supreme Leader of North Korea Kim Il-sung delivered the "May 25 teaching", entrenching his son Kim Jong-il as his designated successor.
events.subtitle: Kapsan Faction Incident
events.headline: Supreme Leader Kim Il-sung Designates Kim Jong-il as Successor

events.originalText: The Baltimore Steam Packet Company, the last overnight steamboat service in the United States, went out of business.
events.subtitle: Baltimore Steam Packet Company
events.headline: Baltimore Steam Packet Company Ceases Operations

events.originalText: In an address to Congress, U.S. president John F. Kennedy announced his support for the Apollo program, with "the goal, before this decade is out, of landing a man on the Moon and returning him safely to the Earth".
events.subtitle: Joint session of the United States Congress
events.headline: President John F. Kennedy Supports Apollo Program in Congress Address

events.originalText: Joe Brown and George Band, members of the British Kangchenjunga expedition,  made the first ascent of the world's third-highest mountain but deliberately did not set foot on the summit.
events.subtitle: Joe Brown (climber)
events.headline: British Expedition Makes First Ascent of Kangchenjunga

events.originalText: The Wehrmacht and their collaborationist allies launched Operation Rösselsprung, a failed attempt to assassinate the Yugoslav Partisan leader Josip Broz Tito.
events.subtitle: Wehrmacht
events.headline: Operation Rösselsprung Fails to Assassinate Yugoslav Partisan Leader

events.originalText: Second World War: German troops captured Boulogne-sur-Mer, France, forcing British forces to evacuate via Dunkirk.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: German Troops Capture Boulogne-sur-Mer, British Forces Evacuate

events.originalText: Employees of the Remington Rand company began an 11-month strike action, during which time the company executives developed the notorious "Mohawk Valley formula" to intimidate the strikers.
events.subtitle: Remington Rand
events.headline: Remington Rand Employees Begin 11-month Strike

events.originalText: Oscar Wilde was sentenced by Alan Wills to two years of hard labor for gross indecency.
events.subtitle: Oscar Wilde
events.headline: Oscar Wilde Sentenced to Hard Labor for Gross Indecency

events.originalText: Gilbert and Sullivan's comic opera H.M.S. Pinafore (poster featured) premiered at the Opera Comique in London.
events.subtitle: Gilbert and Sullivan
events.headline: Gilbert and Sullivan's H.M.S. Pinafore Premieres in London

events.originalText: The English poet Samuel Taylor Coleridge published one of his most famous poems, Kubla Khan.
events.subtitle: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
events.headline: Samuel Taylor Coleridge Publishes Kubla Khan Poem

events.originalText: The Primera Junta, the first independent government in Argentina, was established in an open cabildo in Buenos Aires, marking the end of the May Revolution.
events.subtitle: Primera Junta
events.headline: Primera Junta Established as First Independent Government in Argentina

events.originalText: The Constitutional Convention met in Philadelphia with the intention of revising the Articles of Confederation of the United States.
events.subtitle: Constitutional Convention (United States)
events.headline: Constitutional Convention Meets in Philadelphia to Revise Articles of Confederation

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: US Colonel William Crawford began a failed expedition to destroy British-allied American Indian towns along the Sandusky River in the Ohio Country.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Colonel William Crawford's Expedition to Destroy British-allied American Indian Towns Fails

events.originalText: Ming–Qing transition: Ming general Wu Sangui allowed the invading Manchu to cross the Great Wall of China (pictured), enabling them to capture Beijing and establish the Qing dynasty.
events.subtitle: Transition from Ming to Qing
events.headline: Ming General Wu Sangui Allows Manchu to Capture Beijing, Establish Qing Dynasty
